alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 19 at 2:32AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ACROSS THE HIGH PEAKS OF THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT... Snow showers are expected to develop by late morning and continue through this evening across the northern mountains. Visibility may be occasionally reduced in heavier snow showers. Snow accumulations between 2 and 5 inches are possible mainly above 9000 feet through sunrise Monday. This may create slick roadways, including around Bobcat Pass on Highway 38, Highway 518 through Tres Ritos and Highway 64 east of Tierra Amarilla. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick spots on roadways. Allow for extra time to reach your destination today and tonight. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
